page.title: 16A SCHOOL PLAYGROUND GAME
page.content: { BRITISH BULLDOG}can be played by 10 to 20 children in any open space. {HOW TO PLAY-}Someone is selected to be the{BULL.}The other players are called the{DOGS.}The bull stands in the middle of the area and the dogs remain at one end. The bull calls out the name of one of the dogs. The dog has to run from his side, to the other side without being caught. If the bull catches the dog he must lift him up and shout,{"BRITISH BULLDOG! 1,2,3".} This dog now joins the bull and the game proceeds until all the dogs are caught. The first dog caught will be the bull in the next game. If one of the dogs manages to get across without being caught he shouts{ {"BULLDOG".}The rest of the dogs stampede across. If any are caught they join the bull. At any time the bull may call{"STAMPEDE".
